title: romanbot8
author: romanbot8
content: Hi there!Can anyone advice really safe and secure dedicated or VPS host payed by crypto?Thank you very much for your comment.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.created_time: December 03, 2022, 07:30:13 PMLast edit: December 04, 2022, 07:10:51 AM by OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Have you checked Namecheap (mostly known for domains but provides dedicated servers too) or Vultr? They both accept bitcoin.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: romanbot8 on December 03, 2022, 07:18:37 PMHi there!Can anyone advice really safe and secure dedicated or VPS host payed by crypto?Thank you very much for your comment.I purchased a dedicated server from Namecheap and did not face any problems, they accept payment in bitcoins or altcoins, if you have any problems, the support team responds very quickly and provides several options for accessing those servers.The prices may seem a little high, but they are worth it, and the servers are fairly good.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: Quote from: romanbot8 on December 03, 2022, 07:18:37 PMHi there!Can anyone advice really safe and secure dedicated or VPS host payed by crypto?Thank you very much for your comment.Im using vultr and I have been paid multiple times using BCH everything was good they using bitpay service and they offer $250 credit as signup bonuses Here check this

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: As another option www.steadyturtle.com used to advertise their service here for dedicated server hosting, VPS and shared hosting.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: I am using https://hostingby.design for two years (they changed their name from walkerservers) and I never had any problems with them. The servers have some of the best price-to-performance ratio in the industry. I think only Contabo has better price-per-performance, but they don't accept crypto I think, but my provider does.Quote from: dansus021 on December 07, 2022, 11:51:19 AMIm using vultr and I have been paid multiple times using BCH everything was good they using bitpay service Vultr flagged my account as fraud because I didn't complete KYC. If you want attractive bonuses then you should probably be using AWS.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on December 07, 2022, 05:41:20 PMVultr flagged my account as fraud because I didn't complete KYC. If you want attractive bonuses then you should probably be using AWS.KYC? Were you paying with a credit card? I had a few servers with them at some point and never had any issues.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on December 08, 2022, 06:38:50 AMQuote from: NotATether on December 07, 2022, 05:41:20 PMVultr flagged my account as fraud because I didn't complete KYC. If you want attractive bonuses then you should probably be using AWS.KYC? Were you paying with a credit card? I had a few servers with them at some point and never had any issues.I didn't pay Vultr anything, I literally just registered an account and they asked for KYC 24 hours later.I get that hosting providers want to see at least a temporary copy of your passport so they can protect themselves from credit card fraud (Hetzner and OVH do that too) or they just reject risky CC payments altogether, but alleging the fraud already took place goes too far for me.
